moves.title: General
changes: Fixed bug where the C-Stick could input forward smash backwards when not intending to
Fixed issue where analog inputs were being sent to the wrong slot if heart swapped by Manaphy
Fixed issue where trying to access a model bone that does not exist would cause significant frame drops on console; this in particular affected the SSE Dark Link fight.
Fixed issue where Capsules would occasionally not spawn items
Party Balls no longer can rise after exploding
Fixed issue where Wiimote+Nunchuck could not access hidden character alt costumes
Matched new Green Hill Zone’s collisions fully to the previous version, which caused minor issues with some character tech previously
Space Colony Ark SSZ 1:1 now has the correct spawn points
Bomb Rain and Sudden Death will now spawn Bob-Ombs when the item is turned off in the Item Switch again
CPUs will no longer airdodge offstage as much

changes.title: Random stage select has received a massive overhaul!
changes: All stages are now able to be toggled on or off individually
Hazards are now toggle-able for select stages, which will swap things such as animations, collisions, and hazards when toggled between
Currently supported stages are Smashville, Yoshi’s Island, Green Hill Zone, Fountain of Dreams, Dream Land, and Dead Line
More variants and supported stages will be added in future updates

changes.title: Presets can now be swapped between by pressing L or R on the random stage selection screen
changes: Included presets are as follows: Legal stages (default), PMBR, 2023 Proposed, 2024 Proposed, Australia, Japan, and All stages

changes.title: Controls and features on the stage selection screen have been adjusted
changes: X remains striking, though striking all stages not on random is now performed by pressing X while hovering over the random button
Y now enters the music selection menu
Z will toggle hazards temporarily for the selected stage; this can also be done while hovered over the random button to only random to hazard on/off variants of stages

Holding a shoulder button and pressing Start over a stage will now enter a new alternate stage selection menu, allowing for more 1:1 alts and secret stages. Pressing only Start on a stage will once again select the default stage. R+Start is exclusively used for 1:1 stages, while L+Start’s menu contains different layouts and for-fun stages. Only Temple of Time (L), Castle Siege (Both), and Training Room (R) currently have stages in place

moves.title: Gameplay Changes
changes: Ledge occupancy of ledge rolls under 100% increased from 45 > 48 frames
Footstool frame data normalized throughout the cast, which affects the following characters: Dedede, Diddy Kong, Link, Mewtwo, Ness, Pit, ROB, Snake, and Toon Link
Characters will lose all ledge intangibility frames when performing an aerial or special out of a ledge jump
Behavior when becoming grounded during non-tumble hitstun matched to Melee; this means characters will no longer experience full hitstun when grounded after knockback stacking
Characters cannot be “rehit” if they are hit during invulnerability frames and transition to vulnerable frames during hitlag
Sleep effect attacks will no longer pierce character armor in the air

changes.title: Physics delays have been fixed!
changes: Wavedashes no longer require one frame of being airborne
Characters now experience fastfall physics on frame 1 instead of frame 2
Characters will no longer experience an extra frame of landing lag when they would go into fall the frame they would land
Fixes for more situations are being tested and will be implemented in future updates

moves.title: Other
changes: Limb hurtboxes are now intangible when inside his shell

moves.title: Other
changes: Backwards double jump’s animation will no longer push Falcon too far away from walls for him to walljump

moves.title: Up Special (Fire Spin)
changes: Grounded initial hit can no longer clank

moves.title: Up Tilt
changes: Intangibility given to left arm during active frames

moves.title: Neutral Special (Inhale)
changes: Characters can no longer mash out of the star when spit out

moves.title: Up Special (Dedede Jump)
changes: Landing hitbox startup 3 > 1 to match all other landing hitboxes

moves.title: Neutral Special (Giant Punch)
changes: Animation modified to start slightly less far behind him
Shoulder hitbox added; has highest priority and 55 angle

changes.title: Shoulder and arm damage reduced (fist hit remains unchanged)

moves.title: Up Special (Spinning Kong)
changes: Arms no longer intangible after startup frames

moves.title: Up Special (Fire Bird)
changes: Flame hitbox knockback now matches Fox’s

moves.title: Standing Grab
changes: Animation slightly modified to better match grabbox

moves.title: Neutral Special (Dead Man’s Drift)
changes: Float IASA 4 > 5 to prevent accidental B-reverses when inputting back air

moves.title: Side Special (Squall Hammer)
changes: Grounded landing lag is now forced after the final hitbox terminates

moves.title: Up Special (Belay)
changes: If ledge is grabbed after Nana starts seeking it during Up B, she will now do a small, non-actionable jump above ledge

moves.title: Other
changes: Nana AI chooses forward throw 15 units away from ledge instead of 30
PNT C-stick and buffered methods removed

moves.title: Down Air
changes: Spike hitbox removed; former spike hitbox now matches other sweetspot hitboxes

moves.title: Neutral Special (Eruption)
changes: Now gains armor every 30 frames of charging; 0 > 20 > 40 > 80 > 120 > Super

moves.title: Up Special (Vine Whip)
changes: Can no longer edge cancel endlag of tether landing

moves.title: Attributes
changes: Jumps modified to retain original height

moves.title: Up Tilt
changes: Animation modified to not lean back as much in the initial frames

moves.title: Down Smash
changes: Charging hitbox angle on aerial opponents 365 > 90

moves.title: Forward Air
changes: Animation modified to start further in front of Knuckles

moves.title: Neutral Special (Drill Claw)
changes: First active frame 7 > 8, starts higher than previously

moves.title: Side Special (Glide/Dive Punch/Wall Climb)
changes: Glide turnaround no longer decreases glide frames
Aerial momentum after canceling glide reduced
Wall Climb will now grab ledge while in range if traveling upwards or not moving

moves.title: Up Special (Spring Jump)
changes: Only the first Up Special used per airtime can be acted out of
Fixed bug where only using aerials would provide intended drift
Up B height slightly lowered to account for gravity change (0.94 -> 0.90), remains higher than previous Up B

moves.title: Other
changes: >100% ledge getup attack invincibility normalized to match the cast

moves.title: Back Air
changes: Foot intangibility now ends directly after hitboxes terminate

moves.title: Neutral Special (Inhale)
changes: Characters can no longer mash out of the star when spit out

moves.title: Up Special (Final Cutter)
changes: Kirby will no longer lose all of his jumps during Up B startup and then regain one if performing Cutter Dash. Instead, he will consume all but one jump at Up B startup and lose the final jump if inputting Final Cutter

changes.title: Numerous hat changes have been implemented to make Kirby’s hats behave more like the character he copies
changes: Wario - hold time reflects new Wario changes
Ike - armor matches new Ike changes
Mr. Game and Watch - Can now only throw one bacon per B-press, matching Mr. Game and Watch

moves.title: Side Special (Force Palm)
changes: Aerial Side B throw will now force tumble

moves.title: Up Special (Extreme Speed)
changes: Landing lag when ending on ground 24 > 30
Fixed a bug where Lucario could not sweet spot the ledge while traveling downward unless also holding down

moves.title: Other
changes: No longer starts matches with an aura charge

moves.title: Back Air
changes: Spike active frames 4 > 3, Non-spike active frames 1 > 2

moves.title: Grab
changes: All grab Y-offsets increased by 0.25 to allow Lucas to grab taller characters while standing

moves.title: Down Special (PSI Magnet)
changes: Now stalls vertical momentum after repeated aerial uses

moves.title: Other
changes: GFX added to knockdown getup attacks to accurately reflect hitbox size

moves.title: Down Tilt
changes: Air-only hitboxes added to match Melee

moves.title: Down Special (Mario Tornado)
changes: Animation adjusted to better match 64 and Melee

moves.title: Down Tilt
changes: Animation modified to not wiggle as much

moves.title: Up Smash
changes: DACUS horizontal speed multiplier 3.0 > 2.6, normalized between both frames

moves.title: Up Air
changes: Inner hitboxes Y-offset 17 > 15.75, GFX adjusted to match

moves.title: Side Special (Drill Rush)
changes: Aerial Side B reverse ledge grab adjusted, preventing Meta Knight from warping to ledge while on stage in many scenarios. Note that this can still happen, but should be far less frequent.

moves.title: Up Special (Shuttle Loop)
changes: Loop no longer causes Meta Knight to self destruct off the side blastzone
Self destructs can still happen if startup occurs while already in the blastzone

moves.title: Other
changes: Can now fast fall out of double jump with diagonally downwards angles (matches the rest of the cast)

moves.title: Other
changes: Electric effect added to trip attack

moves.title: Up B (Ionium Jet)
changes: Reverse ledge grab box now terminates after 20 frames

moves.title: Other
changes: Pikmin are now always intangible on frame 1 of aerial attacks
>100% ledge jump no longer gets caught and canceled on some stages

moves.title: Down Special (Thunder)
changes: Fixed rare air-to-ground interaction that prevented hitboxes from appearing

moves.title: Ice Up Smash
changes: Hitboxes/animation no longer goes into the Z axis

moves.title: Fire Forward Air
changes: Changes made to match Melee forward air

moves.title: Side Special (Missile)
changes: Shooting a missile resets fall speed, which allows for SHFF missiles
Can now be input out of crawl exit

moves.title: Other
changes: Hurtboxes now consistent between morph ball animations

moves.title: Forward Smash
changes: Frames between first and second hits 8 > 7

moves.title: Down Smash
changes: Mine model visibility changes: Y-offset -1.5 > -1.25, glow effect added to the flashing beacon

moves.title: Down Special (C4)
changes: Delayed stick removed; will now search for only 3 frames before successful or failed stick

moves.title: Neutral Special (Homing Attack)
changes: Will no longer go into special fall landing during trick animations

moves.title: Side Special (Somersault)
changes: No longer refreshes on ledge grab
Ledge grab box lowered and shrunk

moves.title: Down Special (Spin Dash)
changes: Fixed a bug where additional terminal velocity remained applied when interrupting with another special move

moves.title: Up Special (Spring Jump)
changes: Only the first Up Special used per airtime can be acted out of
Fixed bug where only using aerials would provide intended drift

moves.title: Costumes & Aesthetics
changes: GFX adjusted and improved across Sonic’s moves for better visual clarity

moves.title: Neutral Special (Water Gun)
changes: Full charge has less spread between each projectile

moves.title: Down Special (Bomb)
changes: Bomb Multi Hit count increased from 3 to 4, total damage 9% > 12%

moves.title: Neutral Special (Chomp)
changes: Minimum required hold animation time Min 5/Max 61 -> 12/30

moves.title: Side Special (Egg Roll)
changes: Wall bounce behavior normalized; will always give height on first bounce per airtime

moves.title: Up Tilt
changes: Animation modified to start less far outwards, active frames and startup unchanged

moves.title: Forward Air
changes: First hit reverted to PM v3.6 behavior

moves.title: Up Air
changes: Modified to contort less on startup

moves.title: Up Special (Plasma Wire)
changes: Can no longer edge cancel endlag of tether landing

changes.title: (Base) Bowser’s Castle
changes: Stage size and blastzones are now smaller
Lava adjusted to not oversaturate cathode-ray tube televisions
Heavily optimized to run consistently at a full frame rate
Platform layout changed to an inverted tri-plat layout
All Bowser Castle 1:1s have been updated to the new layout

changes.title: (L-alt) Bowser’s Castle (Thwomp version)
changes: Lava adjusted to not oversaturate cathode-ray tube televisions

changes.title: (Z-alt) World Bowser BC
changes: Lava adjusted to not oversaturate cathode-ray tube televisions

changes.title: (R+Start) Daytime Siege (NEW!)
changes: Daytime Siege has been added to the R+Start list. This is a static version of the Brawl Castle Siege matching PM’s behavior

changes.title: (L+Start) Frozen Underground (NEW!)
changes: The underground phase of Castle Siege has been added to the L+Start list

changes.title: (Base) Fountain of Dreams
changes: Water SFX/GFX toned down based on player feedback

changes.title: (Base) Pokémon Stadium 2
changes: Adjusted lighting to be less blown out

changes.title: (L-alt) Pokémon Stadium 1
changes: Moved to L alt from Z

changes.title: (Z-alt) Treasure Town (NEW!)
changes: A Metal Cavern reskin based on Treasure Town has been added!

moves.title: Smashville
changes: Side blastzones normalized; now set to 150.35 units away from each ledge
Collisions normalized between the left and right ledges

changes.title: (L+Start) The Throne Room (NEW!)
changes: The Throne Room has been added to the L+Start list for Temple of Time. A wider layout variant of the base stage

changes.title: (R+Start) Dark and Config Menu Training Rooms (NEW!)
changes: Have been added as R+Start alts for Training Room

moves.title: Costumes
changes: Zero Suit Samus received a complete model revamp, featuring a texture rework, new hair, and overall model improvements
New costume: Sega Kid Sonic! The long-awaited concept art is now a reality with 4 extra recolors
Revamped costume: Racing Suit Sonic gears up to battle! Additional recolors are available to add in the Modder’s Pack

Sonic and Knuckles now have spinball visual effects that match their costumes; a few costumes were optimized to allow for the extra space. Both Sonic and Knuckles now have smaller costume size limits due to this
Sonic renders retouched to look more accurate to in-game colors
Default Jet Set Sonic has the same fur effects as default Sonic
Jet Set Brown and Black Knuckles: Improved sphere colors
Pikachu has received a model revamp with additional fur details
New costume: Team Rocket Pikachu prepares for trouble! You can make it double with five additional recolors.
Pikachu’s hidden costumes swapped to Detective Hat Pikachu and Jukebox Pikachu. Stay tuned for future updates!

Some of Pikachu’s default costumes have a heart tail. However, by pressing left or right on the D-Pad while loading a stage, your Pikachu will switch which tail shape it has. Play with whatever costume and tail combination you want!
New costume: Hex Maniac Ivysaur wants to battle! Comes with four magical recolors and feature additional ghostly effects
Ivysaur’s base recolors have all been remade to a higher and more consistent quality.
New hidden Ivysaur costume: Clone Ivysaur

New costume: The Great Gonzales costume for Yoshi enters the ring! Four additional recolors have been included in the build, and the Modder’s Pack contains two additional colors. Each costume has a unique hair style.
All Yoshi costumes have new higher quality eyes and optimizations to lower file size
Dorrie Yoshi revamped with new crests, spots, scarf, and some absolutely dripping footwear. Also comes with a new purple color.
Wii ROB has been revamped with a glossy new body, and four additional recolors
Captain Falcon’s vanilla black skin restored; the black and blue palette is planned to return for a future costume
Unintentional change on default Holy War Marth’s texture has been reverted; all costumes in this set had their renders updated as well
Minor optimizations for the following costumes: Griel Ike, PAL Bowser, all Lucario costumes, Gold Morpho Knight, Green Squirtle, PED Samus
Pig Ganon now properly glows purple when using certain attacks
Link’s entry animation received further cleanup
Link’s Ocarina model was optimized, and has a higher quality texture
Animations for Link’s Ocarina taunt have been redone

moves.title: Event Match
changes: Event Match mode has been updated with new UI, along with revamped events.
All preview images have also been updated

Some tracklists have been updated to accommodate Event Match only tracks. Songs are included in the tracklist, but won’t play in normal matches. These tracklists are: Fountain of Dreams, Mario Circuit, P+ Stadium, Skyworld, Smashville
Zero Suit Samus no longer needs to hold neutral special during her Final Smash to clear Event Match 16

moves.title: Items
changes: New EX item: the Double Cherry! Those Ice Climbers won’t be the only ones to pair up now. Can be manually turned on or off by pressing START on the EX Item choice in Item Switch

moves.title: Character Selection Screen
changes: Enhanced with additional glow effects, redone models, and improvements to name entry
You can now swap your port’s color on the character select screen by pressing L or R while hovering over your port. Choose between twelve different options!
Sheik’s CSP render has been adjusted to prevent a small amount of pixels from appearing in the bottom-left of her portrait

moves.title: Other
changes: The ingame HUD has received a makeover; this also scales battle portraits properly for the first time, as they had been scaled too wide since vanilla Brawl!
Subspace EX improvements and bug fixes
Stamina mode warping now affects items and coins
Stamina mode: Ganondorf Side B warping now needs to be continued by pressing B 6 frames or before the warp; if they do not, or the opponent presses B closer to the warp, the grab will break
“Winner” text on the results screen updated to match P+ palette
Sound effects have been added to the Code Menu
The title screen and strap screen have received visual overhauls
Version number updated to v3.0 build-wide
